milestones.text: Start by reading up on the fundamentals: Make sure you understand the basics of Javascript by reading online tutorials or taking a JavaScript course.
Practice writing code: Arm yourself with a text editor and begin practicing your code writing. Try to write a few simple scripts and programs to get a feel for the language.
Use online playgrounds: There are many online playgrounds that can help you test and play with JavaScript code snippets. These can be a great way to get started.
Learn the conventions: Understanding the conventions in JavaScript and how they should be used will help you write cleaner code and understand other people’s code more quickly.
Learn the frameworks: Once you’re comfortable with the language, start learning advanced frameworks like jQuery and AngularJS.

Join the community: Find other JavaScript enthusiasts to chat with, take part in code challenges or ask questions on forums. This is a great way to stay up-to-date on the best practices and pick up new tips.
